snippet: Many in Kandahar, Afghanistan, prospered in the past 13 years. But now, foreign troops are gone, mostly, leaving behind a skittish city, torn between fear and hope.
abstract: Kandahar Journal; many residents of Kandahar, Afghanistan, have prospered during 13-year presence of American troops, but they are now oscillating between fear and hope as international forces prepare to end combat mission and vacate country; fragile peace is being maintained by heavily armed police in city, but apprehension over the future is apparent.
lead_paragraph: Many in Kandahar, Afghanistan, prospered in the past 13 years. But now, foreign troops are gone, mostly, leaving behind a skittish city, torn between fear and hope.

headline.main: Made Rich by U.S. Presence, Many in Kandahar Now Face an Uncertain Future
headline.print_headline: Made Rich by U.S. Presence, Now Left to an Uncertain Future

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
